titleStmt.title: The Querers and Quakers cause at the second hearing. Or, The Quakers antiquering advocate examined: his pleadings found light and weake, his language lewd and railing, his prinicples loose and large. The quaking and entransed faction discovered to be a new branch of an old root, revivied by Satan; some of their strange ungospel-like tenents, unchristian practises, and opinions fathered upon the spirit, to be abhorred, and avoided by all holy soules, are also discovered, and truly laid open.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by I.G. for Nath: Brooke, at the Angel in Cornhil,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
